row 13 cc k1 *mc k* row 14 *mc k* third row of cells row 15 *cc k3 mc k1* row 16 *cc k1 mc k1* row 17 *cc k3 mc k1* in between cells section row 18 and 19 *mc k* fourth row of cells row 20 mc k2 *cc k3 mc k1* to last 2 sts cc k2 row 21 *cc k1 mc k1* row 22 cc k1 mc k1 *cc k3 mc k1* to last 2 sts cc k2 in between cells section starts on 2nd stitch row 23 cc k1 *mc k* optional row of cc dots is on row 24- you can skip the cc and just use mc if you prefer or if you prefer a slightly shorter hat perfect for children s sizes you can skip this row altogether and start on your decrease you can also make the hat slightly taller by adding knit row here in mc before decreasing row 24 mc k1 cc k1 *mc k3 cc k1* to last 2 sts mc k2 slip marker cut cc and leave a long enough tail to weave into finished work row 25 *mc k* decrease round 1 sl1 *k2 k2tog* to last 3 sts k2 remove stitch marker and k2tog using last st and 1 st from next round place stitch marker back after k2tog round 2 *k* round 3 *k2tog k1* round 4 *k2tog* cut yarn and weave through remaining stitches to close up the hat add a pom if desired this pattern and photos are if you re on instagram property of blue barn fiber and i d being credited for the pattern what you make @bluebarnfiber at www bluebarnfiber com nucleus beanie pattern ©blue barn fiber a note regarding sizing my gauge for this pattern is 8 stitches wide x 10 tall over 2x2 for main body and 8 5 stitches lengthwise for the ribbing i recommend doing a gauge swatch to determine the appropriate number of stitches to best fit your head since all heads are different and all knitters use slightly different yarn gauge this pattern is written over a repeat of 8 so if you need to make major changes to the size you ll want to do it by increasing or decreasing by 8 stitches minor changes in size can easily be made by simply keeping the stitch count the same and going up or down in needle size a note regarding color choice
